page.title: 19Local History,West Enfield.
page.content: This area was once part of the Royal Enfield Chase and housing development did not begin until the early twentieth century,when British Rail built the line from Kings Cross to Hertford North.More recently in the 1930's when the tube was built to Cockfosters the large estates were sold to property developers and the area became a pleasant commuter belt. One house of historical interest (Trent Park) is now part of Middlesex Polytechnic ,the surrounding parkland once part of a huge estate,belongs to the G.L.C. and is open to the public as a country park.
